instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
Hi to you all nice people , Merry Christmas first of all :)
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no liquid damage or corrosion whatsoever. Had a short on <CAPACITOR>C7430</CAPACITOR> , replaced it and ppbus went up to 4v (from 0 ) 
now the board is taking 23 mA and i am stuck :) pp3v42 is ok and i do have green and orange light .
Measured around the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and pin 1 is 0 V , that cant be ok .... so traced back to <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR> and they are up to specs .... The voltage there is probably not ok though , on pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> =18.51 and pin 2 =7.51V   and the <RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR> pin 1 =7.51 and pin 2 = 0 V

The <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> 
pin 1 and 2 = 18.51
pin 3 = 7.51
pin 4 and 5 = 17.95
pin 6 = 17.79

if you had this board would you replace the isl or <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> ? :)

Thanks in advance

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
Merry Christmas too!

<TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> looks good, as you get correct output voltage.

Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.
Also check R/C networks from pins 5, 7, 8.
You may need to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.

Check <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> voltage, removing F7140.

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos 
thanks for your reply

resistance between 17/18 is 3.3 Ohm , resistance on 27/28 is 20.2 Ohm
voltage on <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> when F7140 removed is 8.58 on all pins
Voltages on <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> 
1 = 9.7V
2, 3 ,4,9 =17.94 V
5,6,7 = gnd
8 = 0.6 V
10 = 8.57 V

the only thing that shows any sign of heating up on thermal cam is the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>  ( up to 30 celsius ) 

thanks again for your help

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
If you get 8.58V at <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> removing F7140, then no problems on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> area.
Resolder F7140 and post diode mode (both directions to ground) at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message: on pin 1 I have 0.150 and on pin 2 i have 0.259

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
on F7140 :)
i always thought they should measure the same but i get different values ....

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
Then the fuse is burnt.
Guess the next step...

threads.title: 00165 ppbus stuck at 4v
threads.message:
Jesus do i feel stupid ..... I DID check it in the initial stage and it was still ok :) guess it said goodbye during the reparation  :)
What can i say besides thank you a thousand times !!!
mark it as solved :)
